restSearch module¶

Contains functions relating to searching for publications.

restSearch.addAuthors(self, pubs)¶

Adds authors to the SQL result of getting publications.*

Parameters:pubs – A List of publication details
restSearch.advancedSearch(self, searchTerms, skip, length, sortBy, sort)¶

Performs an advanced search on the database. :param searchTerms: A json array containing json objects with three fields: field, operator and value.

Valid field`s may be found by :func:`restSearch.getAdvancedSearchFields Valid `operator`s are “equals” and “contains”. Valid `value`s may be any string. :param skip: Pagination- start of page. :param length: Pagination- amount of results. :param sortBy: A string representing a db column to sort the results by. :param sort: A tring that determines whether to sort ascending or decenting.

Returns:A json array of objects representing publications and their authors.
restSearch.decorateAdvancedSearchTerms(terms)¶

Update the field term so as to add ‘LIKE’ or ‘=’ so it may be used in an SQL statement.

restSearch.getAdvancedSearchFields()¶

Finds the fields by which an advanced search may be done

Returns:A json array containing all the fields by which an advanced search may be done.
restSearch.getSQLQueryAndValues(terms)¶

Decomposes the json array of search terms to an SQL query and a string array of values to be sanitized before they are inserted into the query. See SqliteWrapper.query()

restSearch.simpleSearch(self, searchTerm, skip, length, sortBy, sort)¶

Does a simple search on the database entries.

Parameters:
  • searchTerm – The string term to search the database for.
  • skip – An integer defining which result to return first: for pagination.
  • length – An integer defining how many terms to return: for pagination.
  • sortBy – A database column name to sort the results by.
  • sort – A string defining whether to sort ascending or descending.
Returns:

A stringified json array with objects containing details of publications matching the search-term
restSearch.sortDocuments(self, sortBy, sort)¶

Generates a SQL command to do sorting

Parameters:
  • sortBy – A String representing a database column to sort by.
  • sort – A string which determines whether to sort ascending or decending.
restSearch.updateAdvancedSearchTermsFields(terms, dbCols)¶

Replaces the field term values with the actual database column names

Parameters:
  • terms – The json search terms. See “func:restSearch.advancedSearch
  • dbCols – A dictionary containing the database columns, indexed by their field name.
